tophersmith.security.headers.impl

Class ContentSecurityPolicyHeader

  • java.lang.Object
    • tophersmith.security.headers.impl.AbstractHeader
      • tophersmith.security.headers.impl.ContentSecurityPolicyHeader

  • public class ContentSecurityPolicyHeader
extends AbstractHeader
    The Content-Security-Policy header is used in response headers to inform the User-Agent from where certain kinds of resources may be loaded. This defends against XSS, UI Redress, and many other kinds of attacks
    Author:
    Chris Smith

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ContentSecurityPolicyHeader(CSPHeaderName headerName)
      Constructs a new Content-Security-Policy Header object Does not configure a CSP by default, and does not enable report-only mode, also does not reduce
      ContentSecurityPolicyHeader(CSPHeaderName headerName, boolean reportOnly)
      Constructs a new Content-Security-Policy Header object Does not configure a CSP by default
